description: Nearly perfect for what it is intended to do. Just know this -- it ain't Open OneNote or a fancy variant of Wordpad.... but in some areas it is far better than either. Markdown note support is great, especially with more ways to Copy HTML - Paste. Thanks to the dev(s) for keeping this relevant and evolving.
summary: Great app, markdown notes are the teets

description: Really like this app, takes just a little while to get used to. But after that your making notes in no time.
summary: Great Note App! Try it out

description: i am unable understand why it is not installing some error caused snap-install to install-snap ????
What good is an app if it doesn't even launch? I honestly don't have an opinion on it's usefulness since it won't launch at all. Tried to restart snap, but that didn't work either.
Looks good and has many options!

Took a bit to navigate it (lost some pages by accidentally hitting the help icon, apparently I was creating notes under HELP and not a separate notebook), But I was super impressed!
Very clean and smooth UI, the addition of PDF file insertion was genius, I can have quick access to all my notes in one place.
I'm getting used to the formatting style (super cool, not super convenient but works great for now!) Not as easy OneNote, but damn. I might like it better.
Maybe password locking of sections, and drawing/sketch on the background without the box around it would be neat editions!

Overall I'm so pleased so have such a clean and nice note taking app on Linux. You really helped me out as a student running on linux!
Great app, this one didn't work for me. Installed the .deb package from their website and it works
summary: Get from their website, not from here

description: After install completed, I was unable to find the app to launch it.

This is pretty cool, and you are able to sync over devices. But as a onenote user- using for sketching out rough business ideas, research, contacts, links this micropad is not ideal. It operates with markdown- not great for non-programmers or anyone else in my opinion- a WYSIWYG style based editor would be far faster and more usefull for a user like me. 

Website should elaborate more on the encryption and how the dev handles it on his servers in terms of security and privacy.
gooooooooooooooooooooooood
I was looking for something I could use to replace OneNote when I switched and this works really well for me.
Great, if only the PDF output will resemble the free-style of elements putted onto canvas. By now (2020-11-12), it's linear, with oldest elements on the top of the printed page.

Themes are nice! Layout is good! 
BUT, IF I can't change the FONT to at least double, triple or MORE, any app becomes obsolete for us, seeing impaired. I have my Ubuntu "scaling" bumped to 1.5 and settings font settings to 20, but do to many devs, don't care about the seeing impaired, and don't allow the USER to adjust their OWN Font size? 
Answer in 60% of the apps..... NO!
Uninstall time for the forth of these NOTES apps in a ROW!

And this one had the most potential !
summary: Looks great.... if I can see the FONT!

description: very sad, I liked this app so much. brilliant idea. but stability is important. there should be a bug on sync between different PCs.
Saved yesterday's record not opening

on ubuntu studio 21.10
-doesn't save anything (although says so) 
-can not attach pdf from other devices (partitions) says has no permissions
-drawing is not saved (not even shown when closing the element)

would be a great tool if this would work
I don't try app yet, but it seems great and powerful.
summary: Greates app for students notes, recommend it

description:
I was looking for an alternative to notepad++ while developing some random logic code and to keep a backup of my code without worrying about saving changes and organizing with the file names ....

It seems to do a better Job where I can organize my notes in Text editor so I dont' have to go and save file clutter everytime. ( First day of download, yet to use this app extensively)
can probably be improved in ways i'll realize later on, but from my experience so far with it i love it! would donate but am broke.

Im großen und ganzen ganz gut.
Läuft stabil
I would like the platform to have a mobile application to have everything synchronized
summary: I recommend it has a good design
